intro: Neoporteria neohankeana, commonly known as the Hawaiian neoporteria, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in coastal and montane forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
